text:
okage. Its not. Did you play this gutter trash on the Wii like myself? Forced to waggle away, unable to swap to a gamepad as the playloop of wiggling quickly became a awful chore, rather than a fun experience? After the great games that Windwaker and Majoras mask were...?

Also, all 3 of you are on the bandwagon, you are all so damn bias cause ya cant tell a good game from a bad one when compared to the previous 3d zeldas before this. My opinion is unpopular, no wagon, your blind bias like the other 3 guys is the wagon more than half of the Internet rides on with the 'groupthink' mentality afraid to call this trash title what it is... Its not a good game man. get over it guys, like Nintendo CAN fail at making games... ITS OK, starfox Zero on the Wii U was also bad... Its OK to admit it.

author: Stuballs

text:
no one is scared to admit the game is bad. the game is just not bad. calling me bias because i've done my research... LOL look at the reviews the game has been given. no, it's not the best legend of zelda. we can both agree on that. however, is it awful as a game? not at all. i think most people enjoyed it from what i'm looking at... https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Legend_of_Zelda:_Twilight_Princess

go ahead and scroll down to "receptions" and tell me i'm full of shit. tell me I'M the biased one. tell me all of those review scores do not mean anything because you played it, did not like it, and decided that everyone who does not agree with you just doesn't know a good game from a bad one.

author: Pixel Vapour

text:
Okay I'm gonna put my opinion in.
I agree with people saying that Skyword Sword had a very dull atmosphere. I was often bored or frustrated in the game. The only thing I enjoyed was the storyline and how the characters looked. To be honest, I never completed the game since I felt pressured to.
As for Twilight Princess, it's my first Zelda game. I love the storyline, the characters, the scenery, the music, everything. I'm replaying it now. Ocarina of Time was amazing too, and now the connections to other games with it are more evident. Wind Waker is fun and seems really easy to me. But I love it all the same.
author: puellamaris

text:
Wow, we are the same! I did not complete Skyward Sword either, for the same reason!Â 

Though I'd rather say that the problem was Skyward Sword had a cartoony feel to it, while Twilight Princess took you back to the the-world-has-fallen-to-evil Ocarina of Time days.
author: Skater_x7

text:
@AngelkittenArtist Yeah, at first I too thought Skyward Sword was... ok...But the time I was playing it back in 2011-12 I really didn't want to play it, I was more into online games and I was not prepared or in the mood of playing a console game with storyline and things like that, so I played and finished the game because you know, if a Zelda game comes out, you just HAVE to play it, and I was forcing myself, it was all my fault...
But the more I remember the game, the more I like it, I think you should finish it or play it again, I realized it is the Zelda game with best gameplay yet, really, the gameplay is just flawless, specially the flying controls!
I guess it is one of those games you get to appreciate when time passes by...
It is a shame you'll never know how was playing all the great Zelda games before TP when they came out, and one of the biggest hypes on videogame history when TP was announced back in 2004.
author: hasta la Vista

text: @hasta la VistaÂ The gameplay is not particularly the issue, however. It is more so the atmosphere as a whole.

text: I son't care which Zelda game Shigsy makes as long as it's a Zelda game made by him that's awesome. They should mix it up between the two, but I think he should focus more on the WW route. sigeru has made lots of drastic decisions, none have been bad yet. I mean, he advised Retro studios to turn Metroid Prime into an FPS. Everyone was mad at first, but look at how immersive those games are. A little bit of the old can't be bad though as long as it has some differences like TP did.

author: VGSoundFX

text:
I have no problems with either games to be honest.

WW was a more typical Zelda, in terms of how it was set, but too a venture into uncharted waters, no pun intended, by changing the artistic design. 
TP, on the other hand, was darker and more gritty but with an artistic design that was more familiar. I don't know that the game was made this way to appease fans or if it was an experiment in returning to OoT. 

To me, TP was the better game, I loved every second of it.

Story was amazing the art style, though different grew on you after a few hours of playing. WW was an AMAZING game and letting Miyamoto go his route would be the best thing for Zelda imo.

author: uigh

text: @Mooglecito TP is catering to the fans but the game was innovative (eg the dragons fought via hookshot) this was partially because it couldnt rely on the m.plus. SS is killer but I almost feel like TP's puzzles were more of a challenge + not as much prompting from Link's sidekick in order to complete tasks. Aside from this SS works well imo. If TP's scale was too ambitious & Zelda builds on the SS route, it could be good. In any case some fans will bash any series, cant win em all.

author: LlamasInYourCloset

text: @AkhmedSync Actually, that's true, but for the wrong reasons. Children tend to play games like GTa or CoD because they think it's cool to play only "grown-up" stuff, so they only buy "mature" games that contain blood, gore and sex. And yet adults are the main demographic buying games aimed at children (like Kirby's Epic Yarn, Katamary or Pokemon) because with their maturity they can appreciate the games for the fun they bring instead of the lack of violence

text:
Most Zelda fans are divided on how the Zelda series should progress. 

Take the WW route, letting Miyamoto do what he wants with his game resulting on the fans bashing it?

Or the TP route, giving fans what they want, only to they bash it later for being more of the same?

Sadly the Zelda fanbase is going to the route of the FF or Sonic fanbase now.

author: lismore1

text:
Not true- all of the bosses in OoT were integral connected to their dungeon:
Gohma: Queen of the Dekus, parasite killing the Deku Tree.

King Dodongo: King of the Dodongos, enemies of the Gorons.

Barrinade: Parasite inside Jabu Jabu

Volvagia: Ancient beast awakened by Ganondorf. Darunia went to slay it. It's mentioned a crapload.

Morpha: OK, you've got me here.

Bongo Bongo: Ancient evil hidden in the well; unleashed by Ganondorf.

author: Aurongel

text: The music was good but the Hyrule field appeared to me very unnatural also because I feld caged the first time I walked on it, you could only go one way because the other ways were closed by rocks! That seemed very implausible to me. Thats one example but the whole game is composed like this: You have to go one direction with no stops and very seldom sidequests. Nice graphics, yes, but this didnt impress me just like "Star Fox Adventures" for GC. Also boring story, only the bosses were good :)
author: Elmar live

text: Thank you. Yeah, they all are very similar and in particular TP to OoT. Myamoto said this had been the last Zelda game in its old style. So by and by it was time to modernize Zelda and make it a mature game. With TP they topped the highest mountain of my patience. I'm ready to forgive, if the current project will blow me away.
author: Elmar live

text: You have a right to your opinion, I don't know why everyone's getting so upset with you. Anyway, I think that TP is excellent from what I've played, though I see your point: it is very similar to OoT. (But aren't they all fairly similar?) Anyway, they really need to have some voice acting by now. :P
